<small>Hebrew form: **<big>[[H0859|אַתָּה]]</big>**</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אנתה‎</span> [[BDB#Kt|Kt]]<sub>14</sub> (i.e. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַנְתָּה‎</span>, peculiar to Biblical Aramaic; [[BDB#Qr|Qr]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַנְתְּ‎</span>) **pronoun 2 masculine singular** ==thou== (Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַתָּה‎</span>; Cappadocian and Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אנת‎</span> (Lab<sup>Eph. 1. 67</sup>; [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>A 11</sup> +, **feminine** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אנתי‎</span> ***ib.*** D9, 11, 26+), Nerab <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎את‎</span> ([[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>186. 190</sup>), Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אנת‎</span> (***ib.*** 308); <lookup onclick="bdbabb('Tg')"><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span><sup>**Onk**</sup></lookup> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎את‎</span>, <lookup onclick="bdbabb('Tg')"><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ᵑ7‎</span><sup>**J**</sup></lookup> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אנת‎</span> (<sup>§ 16. 1</sup>); Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); — ***thou***, [[Dan.2.29|Dan 2:29]]; [[Dan.2.31|Dan 2:31]]; [[Dan.2.37|Dan 2:37]]; [[Dan.2.38|Dan 2:38]] etc., [[Ezra.7.25|Ezra 7:25]].
